questions.explanation: 4 (2²), 9 (3²), and 16 (4²) are perfect squares. 20 is not a perfect square, so it is the odd one out.
2, 3, and 5 are prime numbers. 9 is not a prime number (divisible by 3), so it is the odd one out.
10, 15, and 20 are divisible by 5. 23 is not divisible by 5, so it is the odd one out.
8 (2³), 27 (3³), and 64 (4³) are perfect cubes. 30 is not a perfect cube, so it is the odd one out.
2, 4, and 6 are even numbers. 7 is an odd number, so it is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: A, E, I, B
questions.explanation: A, E, and I are vowels. B is a consonant, so it is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: B, D, F, G
questions.explanation: B(2), D(4), and F(6) are at even positions in the alphabet. G(7) is at an odd position, so it is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: P, Q, R, A
questions.explanation: P, Q, and R are consonants. A is a vowel, so it is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Apple, Mango, Carrot, Banana
questions.explanation: Apple, Mango, and Banana are fruits. Carrot is a vegetable, so it is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Dog, Cat, Cow, Table
questions.explanation: Dog, Cat, and Cow are animals (living beings). Table is a non-living object, so it is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Rose, Lotus, Jasmine, Potato
questions.explanation: Rose, Lotus, and Jasmine are flowers. Potato is a vegetable, so it is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Pen, Pencil, Eraser, Marker
questions.explanation: Pen, Pencil, and Marker are used for writing. Eraser is used for removing writing, so it is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Triangle, Square, Circle, Cube
questions.explanation: Triangle, Square, and Circle are 2D shapes. Cube is a 3D shape, so it is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Iron, Gold, Silver, Wood
questions.explanation: Iron, Gold, and Silver are metals. Wood is not a metal, so it is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Meter, Kilogram, Kilometer, Centimeter
questions.explanation: Meter, Kilometer, and Centimeter are units of length. Kilogram is a unit of weight, so it is the odd one out.
12, 15, and 18 are double-digit numbers. 5 is a single-digit number, so it is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Morning, Afternoon, Midnight, Evening
questions.explanation: Morning, Afternoon, and Evening are daytime periods. Midnight is nighttime, so it is the odd one out.

questions.questionText: Find the odd one out: Hot-Cold, Day-Night, Big-Large, Happy-Sad
questions.explanation: Hot-Cold, Day-Night, and Happy-Sad are opposite pairs. Big-Large are synonyms (similar meaning), so it is the odd one out.
